comments.html: "A" has two routes (ECMP probably due to equal IGP cost) to "D" next-hop (from IBGP advertisement from "RR") . As "C" is peering with "Y" directly via EBGP, it's prefering the path via EBGP. Hence if a packet from "A" is hitting "C", it's going directly to "Y". This would be a use case for BGP ORR, isn't it? :D
